devdoc.details: This contract should be deployed with a base Swap.sol address and a SynapseBridge.sol address, otherwise, it will not function.

params.tokenAmount: the amount of LP token to burn
params.tokenIndex: index of which token will be withdrawn

returns.availableTokenAmount: calculated amount of underlying token available to withdraw

calculateTokenAmount(uint256[],bool).details: This shouldn't be used outside frontends for user estimates.

params.amounts: an array of token amounts to deposit or withdrawal, corresponding to pooledTokens. The amount should be in each pooled token's native precision.
params.deposit: whether this is a deposit or a withdrawal

returns._0: token amount the user will receive

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction*
params.minDy: the min amount the user would like to receive, or revert to only minting the SynERC20 token crosschain.
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge
params.tokenIndexFrom: the token the user wants to swap from
params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to swap to

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to

params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to swap to

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to redeem into the bridge

params.amount: Amount of (typically) LP token to pass to the nodes to attempt to removeLiquidity() with to redeem for the underlying assets of the LP token
params.chainId: which underlying chain to bridge assets onto
params.liqDeadline: Specificies the deadline that the nodes are allowed to try to redeem/swap the LP token*
params.liqMinAmount: Specifies the minimum amount of the underlying asset needed for the nodes to execute the redeem/swap
params.liqTokenIndex: Specifies which of the underlying LP assets the nodes should attempt to redeem for
params.to: address on other chain to redeem underlying assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees
params.chainId: which underlying chain to bridge assets onto
params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction*
params.minDy: the min amount the user would like to receive, or revert to only minting the SynERC20 token crosschain.
params.to: address on other chain to redeem underlying assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge
params.tokenIndexFrom: the token the user wants to swap from
params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to swap to

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to redeem into the bridge

params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.deadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction*
params.liquidityAmounts: the amounts of each token to add, in their native precision
params.minToMint: the minimum LP tokens adding this amount of liquidity should mint, otherwise revert. Handy for front-running mitigation
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.liqDeadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction
params.liquidityAmounts: the amounts of each token to add, in their native precision
params.minDy: the min amount the user would like to receive, or revert to only minting the SynERC20 token crosschain.
params.minToMint: the minimum LP tokens adding this amount of liquidity should mint, otherwise revert. Handy for front-running mitigation
params.swapDeadline: latest timestamp to accept this transaction*
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge
params.tokenIndexFrom: the token the user wants to swap from
params.tokenIndexTo: the token the user wants to swap to

devdoc.title: L1BridgeZap

calculateRemoveLiquidityOneToken(uint256.notice: Calculate the amount of underlying token available to withdraw when withdrawing via only single token

calculateTokenAmount(uint256[],bool).notice: A simple method to calculate prices from deposits or withdrawals, excluding fees but including slippage. This is helpful as an input into the various "min" parameters on calls to fight front-running

methods.constructor: Constructs the contract, approves each token inside of baseSwap to be used by baseSwap (needed for addLiquidity())

depositETH(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Wraps SynapseBridge deposit() function to make it compatible w/ ETH -> WETH conversions

depositETHAndSwap(address,uint256,uint25.notice: Wraps SynapseBridge depositAndSwap() function to make it compatible w/ ETH -> WETH conversions

redeemAndRemove(address,uint256,address,.notice: Wraps redeemAndRemove on SynapseBridge Relays to nodes that (typically) a wrapped synAsset ERC20 token has been burned and the underlying needs to be redeeemed on the native chain. This function indicates to the nodes that they should attempt to redeem the LP token for the underlying assets (E.g "swap" out of the LP token)

redeemAndSwap(address,uint256,address,ui.notice: Wraps redeemAndSwap on SynapseBridge.sol Relays to nodes that (typically) a wrapped synAsset ERC20 token has been burned and the underlying needs to be redeeemed on the native chain. This function indicates to the nodes that they should attempt to redeem the LP token for the underlying assets (E.g "swap" out of the LP token)

zapAndDeposit(address,uint256,address,ui.notice: Combines adding liquidity to the given Swap, and calls deposit() on the bridge using that LP token

zapAndDepositAndSwap(address,uint256,add.notice: Combines adding liquidity to the given Swap, and calls depositAndSwap() on the bridge using that LP token

userdoc.notice: This contract is responsible for handling user Zaps into the SynapseBridge contract, through the Synapse Swap contracts. It does so It does so by combining the action of addLiquidity() to the base swap pool, and then calling either deposit() or depositAndSwap() on the bridge. This is done in hopes of automating portions of the bridge user experience to users, while keeping the SynapseBridge contract logic small.
